body: @Theoneyardstreet $ZIM
Agreed with above .
My question is different.
Shareholder Guptastocks buys ZIM shares on March 23 and March 24 and holds it beyond March 25th.
These shares are not eligible for dividend given these will not settle by record date March 24th.
On Mar 26- Guptastocks sell those shares in market and market sells these shares to a  buyer XYZ assuming that he will get dividend..
How would XYZ identify which share has dividend attached to it or not?
$ZIM My understanding is the div arrives late to Shareholder B but still arrives via ‚ÄúDue Bill Tracking‚Äù from Shareholder A.
That‚Äôs my understanding at least.
$ZIM @Guptastocks
Check it out:
https://robinhood.com/us/en/support/articles/due-bill-process/
- ZIM owes all shares the dividend
- Shareholder A owns shares on March 22nd and holds until March 25th
- ZIM has Shareholder A on record and thus has to pay the dividend to Shareholder A by ex div date April 4th
- Shareholder B buys all Shareholder A‚Äôs shares on March 25th
- These shares are tagged with ‚ÄúDue Bill Tracking‚Äù
- Shareholder B holds until ex div date April 4th and is still entitled to the dividend

- The mechanism of the dividend flows through Shareholder A (because they were on record by 24th) but eventually arrives at Shareholder B (because they held before and after ex div date) and this mechanism is ‚ÄúThe Due Bill Process‚Äù
